moves.1. d4: Knights end up being thought less of by lots of players due to their lack of range. I find that they are one of the more powerful piece of the army. Here they preform a neat little checkmate.
KID like I said very common between us.
moves.13... Qf6 14. Ne2 fxe4 15. Bxe4 Kh7: Only move to stop all the threats.
moves.16. Rad1 Bf5 17. Bxf5 Qxf5 18. Qxf5 Rxf5: From here on the white knight begin to take a foot hold notice the e6 square is an excellent outpost.
moves.19. Nfd4 Re5: I give up a pawn for activity though my rook is locked in when the knight comes to e6.
moves.20. Nxf4 Re4 21. Nfe6 Be5: My rook and bishop make up for the knights grand activity.
moves.22. f3 Re3 23. Nb5: Here I thought I had a good line going and its not bad. I challenge whites control of the center though white will get a good grip.
moves.23... c6 24. dxc6 bxc6 25. Nxd6 Rxa3: ? this is my mistake much better was Bb2. I thought I would have the upper hand but I missed move 28. Nc4. in my calculation.
moves.26. b5 cxb5 27. cxb5 Nb4 28. Nc4: Fork that is impossible to get out of. I though white would play Re1 Nd3! and black should have the upper hand.
moves.30... Kh8 31. Ne5: Threatens mate. Nxg6+ Kg8 Rg7#. This mate can only be avoid by Rg8 unfortunately it walks into another.
moves.31... Rg8 32. Nf7+: Kh7 Ng5++ Kh8 Rh7# a beautiful finish.
